sections.heading: What is Masu Form?
sections.content:
ます (masu) form is the polite present/future tense of verbs. It's the most common polite form in Japanese.

食べます (tabemasu) - eat/will eat 行きます (ikimasu) - go/will go します (shimasu) - do/will do

children.heading: 1. Formal/Polite Situations
children.content: - With strangers - With superiors/teachers/bosses - With customers - In business settings - In formal speech

children.heading: 2. Default Polite Speech
children.content: 明日行きます "I will go tomorrow" 毎日勉強します "I study every day" 日本語を話します "I speak Japanese"

children.heading: 3. Safe Choice
children.content: When unsure about formality level, use ます form!

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content:
Change final -u sound to -i , then add ます:

買う (kau) → 買います (kaimasu) ka-u → ka-imasu 書く (kaku) → 書きます (kakimasu) kak-u → kak-imasu 読む (yomu) → 読みます (yomimasu) yom-u → yom-imasu 話す (hanasu) → 話します (hanashimasu) hanas-u → hanas-imasu

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content:
Drop る , add ます :

食べる (taberu) → 食べます (tabemasu) tabe-ru → tabe-masu 見る (miru) → 見ます (mimasu) mi-ru → mi-masu 寝る (neru) → 寝ます (nemasu) ne-ru → ne-masu 起きる (okiru) → 起きます (okimasu) oki-ru → oki-masu

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する (suru) → します (shimasu) 来る (kuru) → 来ます (kimasu)

sections.heading: Conjugation Chart
sections.content: | Verb Type | Dictionary | Masu Form | Rule | | --------- | ---------- | --------- | -------------- | | Godan | 書く | 書きます | u→i + masu | | Godan | 飲む | 飲みます | u→i + masu | | Godan | 買う | 買います | u→i + masu | | Ichidan | 食べる | 食べます | drop る + masu | | Ichidan | 見る | 見ます | drop る + masu | | Irregular | する | します | memorize | | Irregular | 来る | 来ます | memorize |

sections.heading: Masu-stem (Verb Stem)
sections.content:
The part before ます is called the masu-stem :

食べます → 食べ (masu-stem) 行きます → 行き (masu-stem)

This stem is useful for other forms!

children.heading: Present Habitual
children.content: 毎日コーヒーを飲みます "I drink coffee every day" 日本に住んでいます "I live in Japan"

children.heading: Future
children.content: 明日学校に行きます "I will go to school tomorrow" 来週日本へ行きます "I will go to Japan next week"

children.heading: Daily Actions
children.content: 食べます (tabemasu) - eat 飲みます (nomimasu) - drink 見ます (mimasu) - see/watch 聞きます (kikimasu) - listen/hear 話します (hanashimasu) - speak 読みます (yomimasu) - read 書きます (kakimasu) - write 寝ます (nemasu) - sleep 起きます (okimasu) - wake up

children.heading: Movement
children.content: 行きます (ikimasu) - go 来ます (kimasu) - come 帰ります (kaerimasu) - return 出ます (demasu) - go out 入ります (hairimasu) - enter

children.heading: Activities
children.content: 勉強します (benkyou shimasu) - study 働きます (hatarakimasu) - work 遊びます (asobimasu) - play 買います (kaimasu) - buy 作ります (tsukurimasu) - make

sections.heading: Question Form
sections.content:
Add か at the end:

食べますか？ "Do you eat? / Will you eat?" 明日来ますか？ "Will you come tomorrow?" 日本語を話しますか？ "Do you speak Japanese?"

sections.heading: Using with Particles
sections.content: 私は本を読みます "I read books" 田中さんは日本に行きます "Tanaka will go to Japan" 毎日学校で勉強します "I study at school every day"

sections.heading: Negative Form: ません
sections.content:
食べます → 食べません (don't eat) 行きます → 行きません (don't go) します → しません (don't do) 来ます → 来ません (don't come)

More details in Masen Form lesson.

sections.heading: Past Form: ました
sections.content:
食べます → 食べました (ate) 行きます → 行きました (went) します → しました (did) 来ます → 来ました (came)

More details in Mashita Form lesson.

sections.heading: Polite vs Plain
sections.content:
| Plain | Polite | Meaning | | ------ | -------- | ------- | | 食べる | 食べます | eat | | 行く | 行きます | go | | する | します | do | | 来る | 来ます | come | | 見る | 見ます | see |

Important: Use polite with people you don't know well!

children.heading: Godan Example: 書く (write)
children.content: Identify as Godan (ends in -ku) Change -u to -i: kak-u → kak-i Add ます: kak-i → kak-i-masu Result: 書きます

children.heading: Ichidan Example: 食べる (eat)
children.content: Identify as Ichidan (ends in -eru) Drop る: tabe-ru → tabe Add ます: tabe → tabe-masu Result: 食べます

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong Group Identification
children.content: Wrong: 帰る (Godan) → 帰ます ❌ Right: 帰る → 帰ります ✓ Wrong: 食べる (Ichidan) → 食びます ❌ Right: 食べる → 食べます ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: Forgetting to Change u→i (Godan)
children.content: Wrong: 買う → 買ます ❌ Right: 買う → 買います ✓ Wrong: 読む → 読ます ❌ Right: 読む → 読みます ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Double Conjugation
children.content: Wrong: 食べますした ❌ Right: 食べました ✓ Wrong: 行きますか? → はい、行きますます ❌ Right: はい、行きます ✓

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using with Wrong Particles
children.content: Wrong: 学校をいきます ❌ Right: 学校に行きます ✓

children.heading: Daily Routine
children.content: 毎朝6時に起きます "I wake up at 6 every morning" 朝ご飯を食べます "I eat breakfast" 電車で会社に行きます "I go to the company by train" 夜10時に寝ます "I sleep at 10 PM"

children.heading: Future Plans
children.content: 明日友達と映画を見ます "I'll watch a movie with friends tomorrow" 来週日本へ行きます "I'll go to Japan next week" 来年日本語を勉強します "I'll study Japanese next year"

children.heading: Regular Activities
children.content: 毎日本を読みます "I read books every day" 週末に買い物をします "I shop on weekends" 時々友達と遊びます "I sometimes play with friends"

sections.heading: Building Longer Sentences
sections.content:
Use て-form to connect actions:

朝起きて、朝ご飯を食べて、学校に行きます "I wake up, eat breakfast, and go to school"

But the final verb uses ます!

sections.heading: Formal Speech Levels
sections.content:
ます form is standard polite , not the highest level:

Most casual: 食べる Standard polite: 食べます ← Most common Very formal: 召し上がります

For daily use, ます form is perfect!

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ ます form = polite present/future ✓ Used in formal/polite situations ✓ Godan: change u→i + ます ✓ Ichidan: drop る + ます ✓ Irregular: する → します, 来る → 来ます ✓ Expresses both present and future ✓ Safe default choice when unsure ✓ Add か for questions

Master ます form - it's essential for polite Japanese!

Next: Mashita Form (Polite Past)

Related:
